description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军开国上将，原名李德三。曾任中国人民解放军副总参谋长、中国人民志愿军参谋长、国防部副部长等职。因与中共一大代表、哲学家李达同名，而被称作“武李达”。
description.en: A founding general of the People's Liberation Army of China, original name Li Desan. He served as Deputy Chief of the General Staff of the PLA, Chief of Staff of the Chinese People's Volunteer Army, and Vice Minister of National Defense. Due to sharing the same name with Li Da, a delegate to the First National Congress of the CPC and a philosopher, he was known as 'Wu Li Da' (Military Li Da).

description.zh-cn: 位于中国陕西省的县，是李达的出生地。
description.en: A county in Shaanxi Province, China, and the birthplace of Li Da.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国首都，李达逝世的地点。
description.en: The capital of the People's Republic of China, and the place where Li Da passed away.

description.zh-cn: 由冯玉祥创办的军事学校，李达曾在此学习。
description.en: A military school founded by Feng Yuxiang, where Li Da studied.

description.zh-cn: 中国军阀，创办了西北军第二军官学校。
description.en: Chinese warlord who founded the Northwest Army Second Military Officers' School.

description.zh-cn: 中国国民党创建的军队，李达早期曾在此服役。
description.en: The military arm of the Kuomintang (KMT), where Li Da served in his early career.

description.zh-cn: 1931年发生于江西宁都的国民革命军第26路军起义事件，李达参与此次起义后加入红军。
description.en: An uprising of the 26th Route Army of the National Revolutionary Army in Ningdu, Jiangxi in 1931. Li Da participated in this uprising and subsequently joined the Red Army.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的执政党，李达于1932年加入。
description.en: The ruling political party of the People's Republic of China, which Li Da joined in 1932.

description.zh-cn: 中国工农红军的主力部队之一，李达曾任其参谋长。
description.en: One of the main forces of the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army, where Li Da served as Chief of Staff.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军开国上将，曾与任弼时率领红六军团西征，李达时任参谋长。
description.en: A founding general of the PLA. He, along with Ren Bishi, led the Red Sixth Army Corps on the Westward Expedition, during which Li Da served as Chief of Staff.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党早期主要领导人之一，曾与萧克率领红六军团西征，李达时任参谋长。
description.en: One of the early main leaders of the Communist Party of China. He, along with Xiao Ke, led the Red Sixth Army Corps on the Westward Expedition, during which Li Da served as Chief of Staff.

description.zh-cn: 中国工农红军的主力部队之一，由贺龙领导，李达曾任其参谋长。
description.en: One of the main forces of the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army, led by He Long, where Li Da served as Chief of Staff.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国元帅，曾指挥红二军团，李达曾协助其指挥。
description.en: A Marshal of the People's Republic of China, who commanded the Red Second Army Corps, assisted by Li Da.

nodes.id: 国民革命军第十八集团军第129师

zh-cn: 国民革命军第十八集团军第129师
en: 129th Division of the Eighteenth Group Army of the National Revolutionary Army

description.zh-cn: 八路军的主力师之一，抗日战争时期由刘伯承任师长，邓小平任政委，李达任参谋长。
description.en: One of the main divisions of the Eighth Route Army during the Second Sino-Japanese War, with Liu Bocheng as commander, Deng Xiaoping as political commissar, and Li Da as chief of staff.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国元帅，在抗日战争和第二次国共内战期间，与李达、邓小平长期共事。
description.en: A Marshal of the People's Republic of China who worked closely with Li Da and Deng Xiaoping during the Second Sino-Japanese War and the Second Chinese Civil War.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党第二代中央领导集体核心，在抗日战争和第二次国共内战期间，与李达、刘伯承长期共事。
description.en: The paramount leader of the second generation of CPC leadership. He worked closely with Li Da and Liu Bocheng during the Second Sino-Japanese War and the Second Chinese Civil War.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党早期军事领导人，曾与李达、邓小平、刘伯承在129师共事并合影。
description.en: An early military leader of the CPC, who served with Li Da, Deng Xiaoping, and Liu Bocheng in the 129th Division and was photographed with them.

description.zh-cn: 原国民革命军将领，1945年在邯郸战役期间率部起义，李达参与了促成其起义的工作。
description.en: A former general of the National Revolutionary Army who led an uprising during the Handan Campaign in 1945. Li Da was involved in persuading him to defect.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军在第二次国共内战时期的主力部队之一，前身为中原野战军，李达任参谋长。
description.en: One of the main forces of the PLA during the Second Chinese Civil War, formerly the Central Plains Field Army, where Li Da served as Chief of Staff.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国在抗美援朝战争中派遣的军队，李达曾任其参谋长。
description.en: The armed forces deployed by the People's Republic of China in the Korean War, where Li Da served as Chief of Staff.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国国防部

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国国防部
en: Ministry of National Defense of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国中央政府的军事部门，李达曾任副部长。
description.en: The military department of the central government of the People's Republic of China, where Li Da served as Vice Minister.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的武装力量，李达曾任副总参谋长。
description.en: The armed forces of the People's Republic of China, where Li Da served as Deputy Chief of the General Staff.

description.zh-cn: 1966年至1976年在中国发生的一场政治运动，期间李达（武）遭受迫害，李达（文）被迫害致死。
description.en: A political movement in China from 1966 to 1976, during which Li Da (military) was persecuted, and Li Da (philosopher) was persecuted to death.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党创始人之一，马克思主义哲学家，曾任武汉大学校长。因与将军李达同名，被称为“文李达”，并在文化大革命期间被迫害致死。
description.en: One of the founders of the Communist Party of China, a Marxist philosopher, and former president of Wuhan University. Due to sharing the same name with General Li Da, he was known as 'Wen Li Da' (Literary Li Da) and was persecuted to death during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 李达将军的配偶之一。
description.en: One of the spouses of General Li Da.

description.zh-cn: 李达将军的配偶之一。
description.en: One of the spouses of General Li Da.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命时期的群众组织，对哲学家李达的死亡负有直接责任。
description.en: Mass organizations during the Cultural Revolution, directly responsible for the death of philosopher Li Da.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国于1958年至1960年间的一场经济和社会运动，曾受到哲学家李达的批评。
description.en: An economic and social campaign in the People's Republic of China from 1958 to 1960, which was criticized by philosopher Li Da.

description.zh-cn: 位于中国武汉市的大学，哲学家李达曾任该校校长。
description.en: A university in Wuhan, China, where philosopher Li Da served as president.

description.zh-cn: 李达出生于陕西省眉县。
description.en: Li Da was born in Mei County, Shaanxi Province.

description.zh-cn: 1926年，冯玉祥创办了西北军第二军官学校。
description.en: In 1926, Feng Yuxiang founded the Northwest Army Second Military Officers' School.

description.zh-cn: 1926年考入冯玉祥创办的西北军第二军官学校，1927年毕业。
description.en: Enrolled in the Northwest Army Second Military Officers' School founded by Feng Yuxiang in 1926 and graduated in 1927.

position.en: Platoon Leader, Company Commander, Brigade Staff Officer

description.zh-cn: 1927年毕业后，在国民革命军第2集团军任职，直至1931年参加宁都起义。
description.en: After graduating in 1927, he served in the 2nd Group Army of the National Revolutionary Army until participating in the Ningdu Uprising in 1931.

description.zh-cn: 李达参加宁都起义后，其所在的部队被编入红军，这成为他军事生涯的转折点。
description.en: After Li Da participated in the Ningdu Uprising, his unit was incorporated into the Red Army, which became a turning point in his military career.

description.zh-cn: 李达于1932年9月加入中国共产党。
description.en: Li Da joined the Communist Party of China in September 1932.

description.zh-cn: 1934年，李达任红六军团参谋长，随军团长萧克、政委任弼时西征。
description.en: In 1934, Li Da served as Chief of Staff of the Red Sixth Army Corps and followed its commander Xiao Ke and political commissar Ren Bishi on the Westward Expedition.

description.zh-cn: 1934年，李达任红六军团参谋长，随军团长萧克、政委任弼时西征。
description.en: In 1934, Li Da served as Chief of Staff of the Red Sixth Army Corps and followed its commander Xiao Ke and political commissar Ren Bishi on the Westward Expedition.

description.zh-cn: 1934年10月，李达调任红二军团参谋长，协助贺龙指挥部队。
description.en: In October 1934, Li Da was transferred to be the Chief of Staff of the Red Second Army Corps, assisting He Long in commanding the troops.

description.zh-cn: 在抗日战争和第二次国共内战期间，李达长期担任刘伯承领导的129师、晋冀鲁豫野战军及第二野战军的参谋长，协助其指挥作战。
description.en: During the Second Sino-Japanese War and the Second Chinese Civil War, Li Da served for a long time as the Chief of Staff under Liu Bocheng's command in the 129th Division, the Shanxi-Hebei-Shandong-Henan Field Army, and the Second Field Army, assisting him in command.

description.zh-cn: 在抗日战争和第二次国共内战期间，李达作为参谋长，协助129师政委、中原野战军政委邓小平进行指挥。
description.en: During the Second Sino-Japanese War and the Second Chinese Civil War, Li Da, as Chief of Staff, assisted Deng Xiaoping, the political commissar of the 129th Division and the Central Plains Field Army, in command.

description.zh-cn: 1938年1月，李达与邓小平、刘伯承、蔡树藩等129师领导人在山西辽县桐峪镇合影。
description.en: In January 1938, Li Da was photographed with Deng Xiaoping, Liu Bocheng, Cai Shufan, and other leaders of the 129th Division in Tongyu Town, Liao County, Shanxi.

description.zh-cn: 1945年邯郸战役期间，李达参与并促成国民党将领高树勋率部起义。
description.en: During the Handan Campaign in 1945, Li Da participated in and contributed to persuading KMT general Gao Shuxun to lead his troops in an uprising.

description.zh-cn: 1953年4月，李达参加抗美援朝，任中国人民志愿军参谋长。
description.en: In April 1953, Li Da participated in the Korean War and served as the Chief of Staff of the Chinese People's Volunteer Army.

relationships.target: 中华人民共和国国防部

description.zh-cn: 1954年10月，李达被任命为中华人民共和国国防部副部长。
description.en: In October 1954, Li Da was appointed as the Vice Minister of National Defense of the People's Republic of China.

position.en: Deputy Chief of the General Staff

description.zh-cn: 1972年10月，李达被任命为中国人民解放军副总参谋长。
description.en: In October 1972, Li Da was appointed as the Deputy Chief of the General Staff of the Chinese People's Liberation Army.

description.zh-cn: 在文化大革命期间，李达遭受迫害。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, Li Da was persecuted.

description.zh-cn: 两位李达因同名在工作中相识，并结下友谊，被传为佳话。
description.en: The two Li Das met at work due to their shared name, developed a friendship, and their story became well-known.

description.zh-cn: 哲学家李达曾任武汉大学校长。
description.en: Philosopher Li Da once served as the president of Wuhan University.

description.zh-cn: 哲学家李达曾批评毛泽东的大跃进运动。
description.en: Philosopher Li Da criticized Mao Zedong's Great Leap Forward movement.

description.zh-cn: 1966年8月，哲学家李达被红卫兵批斗殴打致死。
description.en: In August 1966, philosopher Li Da was beaten to death during a struggle session by the Red Guards.
